title: Intentional Practice-Based Simulation Training for Minimally Invasive Surgery

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental surgical procedures and anatomical knowledge
context.additional_context: A practitioner-focused training program hosted by a medical device company to improve minimally invasive surgical techniques

learning_goals: Participants can perform basic suturing techniques with 90% accuracy in laparoscopic surgery simulations.
Participants can achieve over 85% accuracy in surgical instrument manipulation in three consecutive attempts based on real-time feedback.
Participants score over 70 points (out of 100) in standard MIS skill assessments six months after completing a structured step-by-step training program.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
